explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 44.6degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing fluorine, chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available on substances with melting point of >55degC (melting point: 44.6degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005))).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 21.8mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 177mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 0.0371mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of only mild irritation (a mean Draize score of <=0.5), with effects resolving within 48 hours, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests: "The substance induced reversible irritation reactions of the eyes. Conjunctival effects disappeared after 2 weeks" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests using the Maximization method: "Skin sensitization: negative" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro reverse mutation tests, DNA repair tests and unscheduled DNA synthesis tests, and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells and rat chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and offspring development in rat 3-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including wide base gait, lack of stability, incontinence, salivation and upward curve of the spine, reduced motor activity and abnormal gait, tremors, tonic convulsions and ataxia were found (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In rat subacute toxicity studies, decreased food consumption and reduced body weight gains were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)). However, classification is not possible since no other treatment-related general symptoms or pathological findings were observed.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.053ppb of the crustacea (Mysid Shrimp)) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=6.5 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.
